name: easy_header
description: Automatically insert header/author comment text into file. Easy configuration and powerful customization to fit any needs.

${npm_package_name}.autoInsert.enable.markdownDescription: Automatically insert header from **Template** into new files.

${npm_package_name}.autoInsert.allow.markdownDescription: For which languages header insert is allowed.

${npm_package_name}.autoInsert.languages.markdownDescription:
List of language identifiers for **Allow** negation.  
‚ÑπÔ∏è [known language identifiers](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/identifiers#_known-language-identifiers)

markdownEnumDescriptions:
Use Line Comment style.  
`// Hello`  
`// World`

Insert header text as is.  
`Hello`  
`World`  
No extra commenting is done.  
Attention ‚ö†Ô∏è  
- Use this option as a language specific template overwrite in *settings.json*, as you must use the correct comment charaters in the  **template**:  
	+ `"[language]": { "${npm_package_name}.commentMode": "raw", "${npm_package_name}.template": ... }`  
- Use the comment [vscode snippet variables](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/userdefinedsnippets#_variables) in the **template**:  
	+ `${BLOCK_COMMENT_START}`  
	+ `${BLOCK_COMMENT_END}`  
	+ `${LINE_COMMENT}`

${npm_package_name}.template.markdownDescription:
Header template text or URI. See **Variables** for string interpolation options.  
Template examples:  
- Plain text `Author: ${author}\n(c) ${CURRENT_YEAR}\n$0`  
- File containing header template text in current workspace `file://${WORKSPACE_FOLDER}/template.txt`  
- Static location `file://C:/client/header.txt`  
- Remote `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoft/vscode/snippet/snippetVariables.ts`  
‚ÑπÔ∏è `$0` denotes the final cursor position.

${npm_package_name}.variables.markdownDescription:
Variables for interpolation in **Template** and **Content**.  
You can use all [vscode snippet variables](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/userdefinedsnippets#_variables) and define additional variables in [INI file format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/INI_file#Format) `name=value`.  
`value` is evaluated as JavaScript code before interpolation, allowing for arbitrary complex text.  
Use with caution ‚ö†Ô∏è

${npm_package_name}.logLevel.markdownDescription: Minium log level to print in Output Channel.

${npm_package_name}.update.enable.markdownDescription:
When to update the **header** contents.  
See **Update Content** for options.
